messages.title: Use your vote to get Brexit done...
messages.content: The election on Thursday is your LAST CHANCE to get Brexit done! Lend your vote to James Baker.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We came together, as a country, to take the tough decisions. And we got our economy back on track. So businesses are growing—and we've got more money to spend on the priorities we all share. Priorities like the NHS, police, and schools.
£33.9 billion extra for the NHS as part of our long-term plan.
20,000 new police officers and tougher sentences for the most serious criminals.
End of the soft prison sentence.
English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost.
More funding for every pupil in every school, so every child gets a better education.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour has ignored the North for long enough. They want your vote, but they won’t lend their vote to Wallasey. Use your vote to get Brexit done.

issues.brexitEurope: Use your vote to get Brexit done... Let's get Brexit done – and invest BILLIONS in our public services.
issues.economy: Our economy has grown for ten years in a row. In fact, we've helped 3.7 million more people into work.
issues.education: English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost.
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS as part of our long-term plan.
issues.lawCrime: End of the soft prison sentence. 20,000 new police officers and tougher sentences for the most serious criminals.

community.content: Building 40 new hospitals, hiring more doctors and nurses—investing more.

endorsements.endorsement: The UKIP candidate at the last election is urging traditional Brexit voters to get behind the Conservative candidate James Baker.

quotes.text: NHS long-term plan: Focus on prevention 'could save 500,000 lives'
End of the soft prison sentence
English schools to get three-year £14bn funding boost

images.caption: Vote for James Baker to get Brexit done

examples: We are hiring 20,000 new police officers.
We've helped 3.7 million more people into work.
Labour has ignored the North for long enough.
End of the soft prison sentence.
Building 40 new hospitals, hiring more doctors and nurses.
Our economy has grown for ten years in a row.
Labour has ignored the North for long enough.
We are hiring 20,000 new police officers.
End of the soft prison sentence.

personalStories.story: Labour has ignored the North for long enough.

examples: The UKIP candidate at the last election is urging traditional Brexit voters to get behind the Conservative candidate James Baker.
Labour has ignored the North for long enough.
Labour’s Brexit policy is to DELAY. They don’t even know whether they support Brexit – and they’ve had three years to decide.
Corbyn doesn’t even know whether he supports Brexit.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: This constituency has had the same MP for 27 years. Let me be the fresh start for Wallasey.

examples: This constituency has had the same MP for 27 years. Let me be the fresh start for Wallasey.
